findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract does not tolerate potential reverts from underlying contracts when interaction is part of the main transfer flow.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from the taxes to swap them for ETH. The variable `swapAndLiquify` sets a threshold where the contract will trigger the swap functionality. If the variable is set to a big number, then the contract will swap a huge amount of tokens for ETH. It is important to note that the price of the token representing it, can be highly volatile.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword. This means that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set. Additionally, the constant variables decrease gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.
